title: Atom Probe Tomography Investigation of the Impact of Stacking Faults on InGaN/GaN Quantum Well LED Systems
content: III-nitride LEDs have transformed optoelectronics with InGaN alloys, offering direct and adjustable bandgaps for various applications like LEDs, lasers, and solar cells [1-4]. Today's lighting industry heavily favours blue-emitting structures due to their higher efficiency compared to green emitters, known as the 'green gap' issue [5-8]. Despite ongoing efforts, resolving this efficiency challenge remains a significant obstacle in research and development [3, 7].
